tuv.seg: The working hours of night workers are regulated by the Organisation of Working Time Act 1997
Is faoin Acht um Eagrú Ama Oibre, 1997 a rialaítear uaireanta oibre oibrithe oíche
It is important to be clear about what is meant by night work and night worker
Tá sé tábhachtach go dtuigfí go soiléir cad is brí le hobair oíche agus le hoibrí oíche
Night work means work done in the period between midnight and 7am
Is éard is brí le hobair oíche ná aon obair a dhéantar idir meán oíche agus 7.00 ar maidin
A night worker is an employee who normally works at least 3 hours between midnight and 7am and who works at night for at least half of their working hours in a year
Is ionann oibrí oíche agus oibrí a oibríonn ar feadh 3 uaire idir meán oíche agus 7.00 ar maidin de ghnáth, agus gur san oíche a oibríonn sé/sí leath dá (h)uaireanta oibre i rith na bliana
Night workers' hours of work
Uaireanta oibre oibrithe oíche
In general the maximum average working week is 48 hours
De ghnáth is é 48 uair an chloig an seachtain oibre uasta ar an meán
Normally, a night worker should not work more than an average of 8 hours in a 24-hour period
Ní cóir go n-oibreodh oibrí oíche ar feadh tréimhse níos faide ná 8 n-uaire ar an meán i dtréimhse 24 uair an chloig
The average is calculated over either a 2-month period or a longer period if it is part of a collective agreement
Déantar an meán a áireamh thar tréimhse 2 mhí nó thar tréimhse níos faide más cuid de chomhaontú comhchoiteann é
If the night work involves special hazards or physical or mental strain, then working hours cannot exceed 8 hours in a 24-hour period
Ní féidir leis na huaireanta oibre a bheith níos faide ná 8 n-uaire in aon tréimhse 24 uair an chloig má bhaineann guaiseacha faoi leith nó strus fisiceach nó intinne leis an obair
The employer is required to carry out a risk assessment in order to determine whether the night work involves special hazards, or physical or mental strain
Ní mór don fhostóir measúnú riosca a dhéanamh le fáil amach an mbaineann guaiseacha faoi leith nó strus fisiceach nó intinne leis an obair oíche
Pay rates and leave for night workers are not covered by the Organisation of Working Time Act
Ní chlúdaíonn an tAcht um Eagrú Ama Oibre na rátaí pá ná saoire d'oibrithe oíche
These depend on the terms of the night worker's contract of employment
Braitheann siad sin ar chonradh fostaíochta an oibrí oíche
In general the law regulating the working hours of young people does not permit young people to do night work
De ghnáth ní cheadaíonn an dlí maidir le huaireanta oibre daoine óga go ndéanfadh daoine óga obair oíche
Part 6 of the Safety, Health and Welfare (General Application) Regulations 2007 states the steps an employer must take to ensure the health and safety of night workers

Tá cur síos i gCuid 6 de na Rialacháin um Shábháilteacht, Sláinte agus Leas ag an Obair (Feidhm Ghinearálta) 2007 ar na céimeanna a chaithfidh fostóir a ghlacadh chun sláinte agus sábháilteacht oibrithe oíche a chosaint

Before employing a person to do night work and at regular intervals while an employee is a night worker, an employer is required to make available an assessment of the effects, if any, on the health of the employee

Ba chóir don fhostóir measúnú a chur ar fáil sula bhfostaítear duine mar oibrí oíche faoi cibé tionchar, más ann dó, a bheadh ag obair oíche ar shláinte an té sin agus a leithéid de mheasúnú a chur ar fáil ag tréimhsí rialta fad is atá an té sin ina oibrí oíche
This assessment must be made available, free of charge, to the employee
Ní mór an measúnú seo a chur ar fáil saor in aisce don fhostaí
Alternatively, if the employee is entitled to have the assessment carried out by the State free of charge, the employer must make arrangements to allow the employee to access this entitlement
Nó má tá an fostaí i dteideal go ndéanfadh an Stát an measúnú seo saor in aisce, ba chóir don fhostóir socruithe a dhéanamh chun go mbeidh an fostaí in ann an teidlíocht seo a fháil
If a night worker becomes ill as a result of night work, the employer should, whenever possible, assign duties to the employee that do not involve night work and which are suited to that employee

Má tharlaíonn sé go mbíonn oibrí oíche breoite de bharr obair oíche, ba chóir don fhostóir, más féidir é ar chor ar bith, obair a thabhairt don fhostaí sin a oireann dó nó di agus nach gá a dhéanamh san oíche
If an employee is pregnant and a quarter of her working hours are night work, she may exempted from doing night work if a doctor certifies it may affect her health and safety and that of her baby

Má tá fostaí ag iompar clainne, agus más obair oíche an ceathrú cuid dá huaireanta oibre, féadfaidh sí díolúine a fhail ón obair oíche a dhéanamh má thugann dochtúir teastas di ag rá go bhféadfadh tionchar a bheith ag an obair sin ar shláinte agus ar shábháilteacht na máthar agus an linbh
If there is no suitable alternative work she may be given health and safety leave
Murar féidir aon obair eile a thabhairt di féadfar saoire sláinte agus sábháilteachta a thabhairt di
This also applies for up to 14 weeks after the birth of her child
Tá feidhm leis seo freisin suas le tréimhse 14 sheachtaine i ndiaidh bhreith a linbh
Disputes under the Organisation of Working Time Act 1997 or the Maternity Protection Acts should be referred by making a complaint within 6 months of the dispute occurring
Ba chóir díospóidí faoin Acht um Eagrú Ama Oibre 1997 nó faoi na hAchtanna um Chosaint Mháithreachais a chur laistigh de 6 mhí ón am a tharla an díospóid
You must use the online complaint form available on workplacerelations.ie
Caithfidh tú an fhoirm ghearáin ar líne nua a úsáid á fáil ar workplacerelations.ie
However this time limit may be extended for up to 12 months if there was reasonable cause for not bringing the complaint within the first 6 months
Is féidir síneadh ama 6 mhí eile a thabhairt duit má bhí fáth réasúnta ann gan an gearán a dhéanamh le linn na chéad 6 mhí
The Health and Safety Authority has published a booklet, Guidance for Employers and Employees on Night and Shift Work (pdf)
D’fhoilsigh an tÚdarás Sláinte agus Sábháilteachta bileog, Guidance for Employers and Employees on Night and Shift Work (pdf)

Further information on night work and your employment rights is available from the Workplace Relations Commission's Information and Customer Service – see 'Where to apply' below. Where to apply Workplace Relations Commission Information and Customer Service O'Brien Road Carlow R93 W7W2 Ireland Opening Hours: Mon. to Fri
